items.q: Fill in the blank: The teacher distributed the books ___ the students.
Fill in the blank: The money was divided ___ the two winners.
Choose the sentence that uses 'among' correctly.
options: She divided the cake between all her friends.
She divided the cake among all her friends.

items.q: Choose the sentence that uses 'between' correctly.
options: They shared the prize among John and Sarah.
They shared the prize between John and Sarah.
They shared the prize between John and Sarah and Maria.
They shared the prize amid John and Sarah.

items.q: Identify the sentence with the error.
options: There was a feeling of excitement among the crowd.
He sat between his two best friends.
The secret was kept between the three of us.
She hid the letter among the books on the shelf.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'We need to choose ___ these options and then discuss it ___ the team.'
Choose the best option: 'Trust must exist ___ all members of the group.'
Which explanation best matches modern usage?
options: 'Between' is only for two; 'among' is only for three or more, with no exceptions.
'Between' is generally used for distinct items (often two), 'among' for things not seen separately or within a group.
'Among' can never be used with people.

items.q: Fill in the blank: She felt nervous ___ strangers at the party.
Fill in the blank: The road runs ___ the two villages.
Identify the sentence that is completely correct.
options: They sat among each other in silence.
They sat between themselves in silence.
They sat between the two trees in silence.
They sat among the two trees in silence.

items.q: Choose the sentence with the mistake.
options: He divided his time between work and family.
There was disagreement among the committee members.
She shared the secret among you and me.
They walked between the tall buildings.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'The negotiations ___ the three companies took place ___ closed doors.'
Choose the sentence that contrasts the two correctly.
options: She walked among the two trees and sat between the crowd.
She walked between the crowd and sat among the two trees.
She walked between the trees and sat among her friends.
She walked among the trees and sat between her many friends.

items.q: Choose the sentence that is completely correct.
options: The responsibility is shared among all team members.
The responsibility is shared between all team members.
The responsibility is shared amid all team members.
The responsibility is shared within all team members.

items.q: Identify the sentence with two errors.
options: The secrets were kept among you and me.
The secrets were kept between you and me.
The secrets were kept between the group.
The secrets were kept among the group.

items.q: Fill in the blank: 'They argued ___ themselves about who should lead.'
In the sentence 'There was tension among the players', what does 'among' suggest?
In the sentence 'He stood between his two best friends', what does 'between' describe?
options: A physical position with one on each side
